data.sentence: The word وَمَا comes from the root م ا and is associated with the meanings:

data.meanings: to serve, worship or adore; to protect, grant refuge, preserve save, rescue, liberate; object of worship ie God; (Alif-Lam-Lam-ha) God, the one true God applied as a proper name denoting the true god, comprising all the excellent divine names; a unity comprising all the essences of existing things.
data.sentence: The word اللَّهُ comes from the root ا ل ه and is associated with the meanings: to serve, worship or adore; to protect, grant refuge, preserve save, rescue, liberate; object of worship ie God; (Alif-Lam-Lam-ha) God, the one true God applied as a proper name denoting the true god, comprising all the excellent divine names; a unity comprising all the essences of existing things.

data.meanings: to will/wish. shaiun (pl. ashyaa'un) - thing/matter, affair in any way, at all, what is willed or wished, aught, any extent. In direct objective case it is often used to denote the meaning "a little", "bit", "at all". Adverbially it means "in any way", "at all".
data.sentence: The word شَاءَ comes from the root ش ي ا and is associated with the meanings: to will/wish. shaiun (pl. ashyaa'un) - thing/matter, affair in any way, at all, what is willed or wished, aught, any extent. In direct objective case it is often used to denote the meaning "a little", "bit", "at all". Adverbially it means "in any way", "at all".
The word إِنْ comes from the root ا ن and is associated with the meanings:

data.meanings: to say/speak, to call, to be named, word/speech, utterance, a thing said, greeting, discourse, one who says/speaks. To inspire/transmit/relate/answer/think/profess, emit an opinion on, indicate a state or condition or circumstance. qa'ilun - speaker, indicator.
data.sentence: The word قَالَ comes from the root ق و ل and is associated with the meanings: to say/speak, to call, to be named, word/speech, utterance, a thing said, greeting, discourse, one who says/speaks. To inspire/transmit/relate/answer/think/profess, emit an opinion on, indicate a state or condition or circumstance. qa'ilun - speaker, indicator.
The word أَنْتُمْ comes from the root ا ن ت م and is associated with the meanings: you (plural)

data.meanings: to come, to bring, come to pass, come upon, do, commit, arrive, pursue, put forth, show, increase, produce, pay, reach, happen, overtake, draw near, go, hit, meet, join, be engaged or occupied, perpetrate (e.g. crime), undertake
data.sentence: The word يَأْتِيكُمْ comes from the root ا ت ي and is associated with the meanings: to come, to bring, come to pass, come upon, do, commit, arrive, pursue, put forth, show, increase, produce, pay, reach, happen, overtake, draw near, go, hit, meet, join, be engaged or occupied, perpetrate (e.g. crime), undertake

data.meanings: to become behind, lack, become in the rear, lag behind (strength), become incapable, powerless, be weak. ujuzun - old women. a'jaza (vb. 4) to weaken, frustrate, find one to be weak. mu'ajiz - one who baffles. ajzun (pl. a'jazun) - portion of the trunk that is below its upper part.. . A'jaztu (prf. 1st. sing.): I am unable, became incapable.. Yu'jizuuna (imp. 3rd. m. plu. IV.): They shall be able to frustrate.. Li Yu'jiza (imp. 3rd. m. sing. el.): He can frustrate.. Nu'jiza (imp. 1st. plu.): We shall frustrate.. Mu'aajiziina (ap-der. m. plu. III.): Frustraters.. Mu'jizun (ap-der. m. sing. IV.): Frustrater.. Mu'jiziina / Mu'jizii (ap-der. m. plu. IV. final Nun is dropped.): Frustraters.. 'Ajuuzun (n.): Old woman who has passed child bearing age.. A'jaazun (n. plu.): Trunks.
data.sentence: The word بِمُعْجِزِينَ comes from the root ع ج ز and is associated with the meanings: to become behind, lack, become in the rear, lag behind (strength), become incapable, powerless, be weak. ujuzun - old women. a'jaza (vb. 4) to weaken, frustrate, find one to be weak. mu'ajiz - one who baffles. ajzun (pl. a'jazun) - portion of the trunk that is below its upper part.. . A'jaztu (prf. 1st. sing.): I am unable, became incapable.. Yu'jizuuna (imp. 3rd. m. plu. IV.): They shall be able to frustrate.. Li Yu'jiza (imp. 3rd. m. sing. el.): He can frustrate.. Nu'jiza (imp. 1st. plu.): We shall frustrate.. Mu'aajiziina (ap-der. m. plu. III.): Frustraters.. Mu'jizun (ap-der. m. sing. IV.): Frustrater.. Mu'jiziina / Mu'jizii (ap-der. m. plu. IV. final Nun is dropped.): Frustraters.. 'Ajuuzun (n.): Old woman who has passed child bearing age.. A'jaazun (n. plu.): Trunks.
